Class ParallelMergeSorter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ParallelMergeSorter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ParallelMergeSorter
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class carries out the merge sort algorithm.

      static <E> void parallelMergeSort(E[] a, int from, int to, int availableThreads, java.util.Comparator<? super E> comp)
      Breaks down the array into sub-parts, and puts them into threads in order to be sorted quicker, depending on the available threads

    • Method Detail

      • parallelMergeSort

        public static <E> void parallelMergeSort(E[] a,
                                         int from,
                                         int to,
                                         int availableThreads,
                                         java.util.Comparator<? super E> comp)
        Breaks down the array into sub-parts, and puts them into threads in order to be sorted quicker, depending on the available threads
        Parameters:
        a - the array to sort
        from - the first index of the range to sort
        to - the last index of the range to sort
        availableThreads - the number of threads available to use
        comp - the comparator to compare array elements

      • sort

        public static <E> void sort(E[] a,
                            int ap,
                            java.util.Comparator<? super E> comp)
        Sorts an array, using the merge sort algorithm.
        Parameters:
        a - the array to sort
        ap - the available processors to create the threads
        comp - the comparator to compare array elements
